result.execSummary:
The defendant Sky C. Sparks #267304 was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Battery [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain GFE at fulltime work, school, or a combination of the two, when not fully engaged complete 10 hours community service per week.

Complete any assessment, treatment, and counseling deemed appropriate by agent.
Complete SAFE program and any follow up.
DNA sample w/ surcharge.
Contact w/ victim is at agent's discretion.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

superMiscConds.notes:
No contact with J.F. unless allowed at discretion of probation agent. 
Use of third party for child exchange and visitation.
Defendant to complete SAFE Program Intake Assessment and Department to take into account the completion of DV programming done during confinement in determining necessity of counseling.

records.addlTxt:
Case Called: 2:03 pm. 
Clerk: Amanda.
State appears by ADA Davis Runde, Defendant appears via phone, pro se.
Date and Time set for hearing to address Defendant's letter to Court requesting modification to supervision conditions. 
Defendant requests to have the "no contact" lifted from his extended supervision conditions as well as the SAFE Program. 
State objects.
COURT makes findings.
COURT modifies the "no contact" condition to read - No contact with J.F., unless allowed at discretion of Probation Agent;  
COURT modifies SAFE Program condition to state Defendant to complete SAFE Program Intake Assessment and Department to take into account the completion of Domestic Violence Programming done during confinement in determining necessity of counseling. 
Defendant questions COURT regarding civil judgment placed.  
COURT directs JOC to be corrected to include Civil Judgment for unpaid fees and costs. 
Adj: 2:18 pm

Clerk: Kimberly
Case called: 8:49am
State appears by ADA Ralph Uttke; Defendant appears in person, in custody, with Atty Anne Renc. 

Parties state recommendation for sentencing.
COURT makes findings
COURT ORDERS: Ct. 1 Bail Jumping- Felony- repeater: 5 years WSPS- 2 years IC, 3 years ES. Ct. 2 Battery- repeater- domestic abuse: 2 years WSPS- 1 year IC, 1 year ES. 268 days credit granted on both counts. Both counts concurrent to each other. Deft is eligible for both prison programming- Substance Abuse & Challenge Incarceration. CONDITIONS of ES: Enroll in and successfully complete in SAFE intake program. Absolutely no contact with victim - J.F. Use of third party for child exchange & visitation. Any outstanding costs to be converted into civil judgment.

w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk: Kimberly
Case Called: 3:19pm
State appears by ADA Michael Puerner.  Deft appears in person, in custody, with Atty John Schellpfeffer

Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW.
State moves to:
Ct. 3 Disorderly Conduct-Repeater-Domestic Abuse >> D&RI
COURT grants above

PLEA: 
Ct. 1 Bail Jumping-Felony-Repeater >> GUILTY
Ct. 2 Battery-Repeater-Domestic Abuse >> GUILTY

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 
COURT ORDERS: w/hold sentencing on both counts, run concurrently to each. Ct. 1: probation 3 years with 105 days conditional jail, deft given credit for 105 days already served. Ct. 2: probation 2 years
CONDITIONS on both counts: Complete any assessment, treatment, counseling deemed necessary by agent. Complete SAFE program and follow through. Maintain GFE in full time work/school/combination of the two, when not fully engaged complete 10 hours community service per week. Pay CC. Pay DNA sample and surcharge. Pay one Domestic Abuse surcharge. Contact with victim is up to agents discrection.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: Probable Cause Found

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 9:41 am 
State appears by ADA Mike Puerner; Deft appears in person, in custody, pro se. 
Date and time set for preliminary hearing. 
COURT questions deft regarding representation. 
Deft states he has contacted an attorney to represent him. Deft notes he is intending to hire Atty John Schellpfeffer. 
COURT questions deft re: time limits for preliminary. 
Deft states with certainty that his attorney advised him to waive preliminary hearing, not the time limits. 
COURT reviews waiver of preliminary examination form with deft on the record. 
Court questions deft as to waiver. 
Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made. 
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial. 
Information filed.  
Date set: PTC on 9/1/2015 at 8:30 am with Br. 2 JA. 
Deft requests bond modification. 
COURT notes bond modification must be addressed in assigned branch. 
Adj: 9:49 am
